See Coverage

News - Bishop Burbidge establishes two new Missions

See photos and Twitter coverage from both announcements

View coverage

Featured News & Announcements

Diocesan Press Releases

USCCB: President of U.S. Bishops Conference Offers Condolences and Call for Prayer for Victims and Families Involved in Mexico Earthquake

“Our most heartfelt condolences go out to the victims of this morning’s catastrophic earthquake, which hit off the coast of southwestern Mexico and Guatemala.. I call on the faithful of this country to pray for the victims and their families, as well as for emergency personnel and rescuers."

Read the full statement

Latest News Coverage

Even kids can have a role in assisting in natural disasters

Washington Post | September 8, 2017

The images and stories from the devastation caused by Hurricane Harvey tugged at Arianna Cope’s 11-year-old heart. The sixth-grader at St. Leo the Great Catholic School in Fairfax, Va., asked whether her school could adopt a school in Houston to help those students replace supplies and other items.

Vietnamese Catholic refugees in the U.S. during the 1970s and the 1980s

Dr. Tuan Hoang, Pepperdine University | September 8, 2017

In the summer of 1979, or four years after the Fall of Saigon, they Vietnamese Catholic Community purchased a small Methodist church building in Annadale. The church was converted to Catholic form, apparently with a great deal of volunteer work from the Vietnamese faithful. Called Các Thánh Tử Vì Đạo Việt Nam, The Holy Martyrs of Vietnam.

View all the latest news coverage...

Hurricane Harvey photo courtesy of
The National Guard License: CC BY 2.0.

Arlington Catholic Herald

Life in a country parish

September, 6th 2017

Our Lady of the Valley Church in Luray, with only 333 parishioners, is one of the smallest diocesan parishes.

Events

  • 14th Annual Diocesan Blue Mass

    September 16 | 5:30 p.m.

    St. Thomas More Cathedral

  • Retreat for People Facing Serious Illness

    September 22 | 1:30 p.m.

    San Damiano Spiritual Life Center

All Events

Featured Resources

Bienvenido Hispanohablantes

Te invitamos a que seas parte de la Nueva Evangelización y de la historia de una Iglesia Inmigrante. Ustedes son importantes para nuestra pastoral.

Find a Mass

Our parish locator makes it easy for you to find your parish, as well as schedules for Masses, Confession, and Eucharistic Adoration.

Discover the Faith

Learn more about the Catholic faith and what is involved in becoming Catholic.

Donate to the Bishop's Lenten Appeal

Support the needy and poor, educate and form youth, encourage vocations, and strengthen our diocesan Church.

Featured Programs

Youth Ministry

Find resources and trainings for youth workers and large diocesan youth events to help young people grow in their relationship with Jesus.

Young Adults

Be a part of the Young Church

Marriage Preparation & Enrichment

Discover the beauty of Catholic Marriage

Our Public Service

Watch a touching video highlighting the impact Catholic Charities is making in the diocese with three of its crucial programs. Find information about Catholic Charities, our diocesan Respect Life efforts, and the Virginia Catholic Conference.

It is much more important to realize how much God loves us, than how much we ourselves love Him.

Pope Francis - September 3 on Twitter
